unnormalised: Okay, here's a blog post draft focusing on vehicle launches in the automotive category, aiming for an informal tone and incorporating Indian elements:
## New Wheels Alert: What's Revving Up in the Indian Auto Scene!
normalised: New Wheels Alert: What is Revving Up in the Indian Auto Scene!

unnormalised: Namaste folks! Your friendly neighbourhood car enthusiast here, giving you the lowdown on the latest vehicle launches hitting the Indian roads. The automotive scene is hotter than a Mumbai summer right now!
normalised: Namaste folks! Your friendly neighborhood car enthusiast here, giving you the lowdown on the latest vehicle launches hitting the Indian roads. The automotive scene is hotter than a Mumbai summer right now!

unnormalised: First up, whispers are swirling about Tata possibly dropping a new variant of the Nexon EV. Apparently, it might boast a bigger battery – we're talking a potential range boost of over 450 km. Imagine cruising from Delhi to Jaipur without needing a charge! That would be awesome.
normalised: First up, whispers are swirling about Tata possibly dropping a new variant of the Nexon E V. Apparently, it might boast a bigger battery – we are talking a potential range boost of over four hundred and fifty kilometer. Imagine cruising from Delhi to Jaipur without needing a charge! That would be awesome.

unnormalised: Then there's Mahindra. Remember the Thar? Well, sources say they're cooking up a 5-door version. More space for the family, the luggage, AND your auntie's famous achaar – score! Launch date is still under wraps, but rumour has it slated for early next year.
normalised: Then there is Mahindra. Remember the Thar? Well, sources say they are cooking up a five-door version. More space for the family, the luggage, and your auntie's famous achaar – score! Launch date is still under wraps, but rumor has it slated for early next year.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki ain't sleeping either. They recently unveiled the Fronx, a crossover that looks pretty slick. Price points are expected to be competitive, starting around Rs. 8 Lakhs. Early reviews are promising, praising its fuel efficiency and the spacious interiors (a major win for Indian families!).
normalised: Maruti Suzuki ain't sleeping either. They recently unveiled the Fronx, a crossover that looks pretty slick. Price points are expected to be competitive, starting around rupee eight lakh. Early reviews are promising, praising its fuel efficiency and the spacious interiors (a major win for Indian families!).

unnormalised: And for the luxury folks, BMW recently launched their all-new i7 electric sedan. It’s got all the bells and whistles you'd expect from a Beemer – a massive 31.3-inch Theatre Screen in the back, massaging seats, the works! The price tag? Well, let’s just say you'll need to sell a good chunk of your ancestral property in Goa. Expect it to be around Rs. 2 Cr on road.
normalised: And for the luxury folks, B M W recently launched their all-new i seven electric sedan. It is got all the bells and whistles you would expect from a Beemer – a massive thirty one point three-inch Theatre Screen in the back, massaging seats, the works! The price tag? Well, let us just say you will need to sell a good chunk of your ancestral property in Goa. Expect it to be around rupee two crore on road.

unnormalised: Besides this, Dr. CV Raman, CTO of Maruti, recently gave a presentation highlighting safety features that would be standard in even their budget friendly vehicles. Good to see Indian manufacturers really focusing on keeping us safe!
normalised: Besides this, Doctor C V Raman, C T O of Maruti, recently gave a presentation highlighting safety features that would be standard in even their budget friendly vehicles. Good to see Indian manufacturers really focusing on keeping us safe!

unnormalised: Lastly, keep your eyes peeled for more launches around Diwali – manufacturers love to capitalize on the festive season. We’re talking potential discounts, special editions, and maybe even a few surprise announcements. Until then, keep those engines roaring! (Responsibly, of course!). Also saw news on a upcoming show that will cover 5000 sq ft. of commercial vehicle displays coming to Chennai. That will be fun to see.
